intro: Smythea trichantha, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed smythea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and elongated leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a distinctive yellowish or greenish color. Smythea trichantha is often found in moist, shaded environments and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features.
